articles.title: Kim Jong Un Visits Martyrs Cemetery of KPA Navy
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Visits Martyrs Cemetery of KPA Navy 
						
 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and  first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, visited the cemetery of fallen fighters of KPA Navy Unit 790 who met heroic deaths while performing their combat duties.
					 He was accompanied by Choe Ryong Hae, Ryom Chol Song, Kim Myong Sik, Pak Thae Su, Jo Nam Jin, Hwang Pyong So, Kim Tong Hwa, Hong Yong Chil and Ma Won Chun.
					
					 After receiving a report that commanding officers and sailors of submarine chaser No. 233 fell while performing their combat duties in mid-October last, he took a measure for finding out all their bodies and holding a solemn funeral for them.
					
					 He examined the layout of the cemetery several times and gave a detailed instruction on how to make grave stones and rails and what color of stone should be used. He also instructed officials to have pictures of the fallen fighters carved on their grave stones.
					
					 The above-said commanding officers and sailors thus came to enjoy immortality thanks to his profound loving care.
					
					 Kim Jong Un laid a flower before the cemetery and paid silent tribute to the memory of the fallen fighters.
					
					 Senior officials of the party and army who accompanied him placed flowers before the cemetery and observed a moment silence in honor of them.
					
					 He looked round the cemetery.
					
					 Watching stone pictures of the fallen fighters one by one,  he said that he felt as if they had risen up to greet him.
					
					 Feasting his eyes on the cemetery built in a quiet and sunny place with blue sea ahead, he said that the cemetery is located in a very good place as it is near from where the unit is stationed.
					
					 He said that sailors of the unit have now become able to sail for performing their combat duties as requested by the fallen fighters after bidding farewell to them, adding that he felt much relieved after having a burial ceremony for them. 
					
					 He noted that he could hardly go to sleep, when thinking they died at so young ages, though the defence of the country is accompanied by sacrifices. 
					
					 He said that he felt heartbreaking when thinking of the fallen fighters who served in the navy, their hearts burning with the dream and hope to perform feats with great ambition and their parents grieved at their deaths and their wives who had waited for their return from voyage. He added what bitter sorrow they might feel as he felt so painful.
					
					 After watching the cemetery, he said that there should be the name of the owner of each grave, adding he would like to be that owner and asked officials to carve his name on the grave stones. I will feel relieved a bit only when my name is carved on them, he noted.
					
					 Saying that the martyrs are his comrades-in-arms and comrades, he stressed that although they died before realizing the lifetime desires of the  great Generalissimos under the leadership of the supreme commander, they showed all service personnel how a soldier should carry out the order of the country through their heroic deaths.
					
					 The revolutionary spirit of the martyrs who readily dedicated their precious lives to defending the country's sea will always live on, he said.
					
					 He stressed that not only the sailors of the unit but all the service personnel of the KPA should learn from the exploits and noble spiritual world of the  martyrs who firmly defended their posts till the last moments of their lives and carried out the combat order at the cost of their lives.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Gives Field Guidance to Shipyard
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Gives Field Guidance to Shipyard
						
 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK), first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and  supreme commander of the Korean People's Army (KPA), gave field guidance to the shipyard managed by Ju Song Ho.
					 He went round various places of the shipyard including the sheet metal processing shop, parts assembly ground and general assembly ground to acquaint himself in detail with the shipbuilding.
					
					 He was greatly satisfied to learn that the officials, workers and technicians of the shipyard were waging a dynamic drive to build modern ships.
					
					 He said there is no goal out of reach as long as there are proud and brave workers who heartily respond to the Party's idea of pushing back the frontiers of the latest science and technology and make devoted efforts to translate it into reality.
					
					 Thanks to the wise leadership of Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il solid shipbuilding bases were established in the country, he noted, adding this is a powerful demonstration of the might of the self-supporting national economy.
					
					 He underlined the need to make sustained efforts to build modern ships at the shipyard, noting that the development of the shipbuilding industry is of very weighty importance in the country as it is surrounded by sea on three sides.
					
					 He said that it is necessary to develop the shipbuilding technology, put the production process on a scientific and modern basis and ensure the best quality of all parts as the shipbuilding industry is one of the important criteria showing the nation's level of the development of science and technology and industry.
					
					 In order to build modern ships the relevant units should produce necessary equipment and raw and other materials qualitatively and supply them in good time, he stressed.
					
					 He set forth tasks before the shipyard, expressing his expectation and belief that its workers would creditably perform their honorable mission and duty.
					
					 He was accompanied by Choe Ryong Hae, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the WPK and director of the General Political Bureau of the KPA.

articles.title: Congratulations to Georgian President
articles.content:
Congratulations to Georgian President
						
 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, on October 28 sent a congratulatory message to Georgi Margvelashvili  on his election as president of Georgia.
					 Kim in his message expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and Georgia would favorably develop in line with the desire of the peoples of the two countries and wished the president of Georgia success in his work for the prosperity of the country.

articles.title: DPRK Premier Makes Field Survey of Construction of Breeding Station
articles.content:
DPRK Premier Makes Field Survey of Construction of Breeding Station 
 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Pak Pong Ju made a field survey of the second phase construction project at the Breeding Station No. 621 of the Korean People's Army.
					 He looked round the first phase construction project carried out at the personal initiative of supreme leader Kim Jong Un and under his energetic leadership and acquainted himself in detail with the construction and the breeding of domestic animals of good stock.
					
					 A consultative meeting of officials concerned took place on the spot.
					
					 The meeting confirmed the construction projects to be undertaken at various stages to attain the goal of the 2nd phase construction as intended by the Workers' Party of Korea and discussed measures for ensuring the supply of necessary materials and equipment.
					
					 The construction of a center for breeding domestic animals of good stock is making rapid progress at a time when the Sepho tableland is turning into a large-scale livestock base, he said, calling on the relevant units to creditably fulfill their responsibility and role.

articles.title: CPRK Accuses South Korean Puppet Group of Praising Park Chung-Hee
articles.content:
CPRK Accuses South Korean Puppet Group of Praising Park Chung-Hee
 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet conservative group held on Oct. 26 disgusting "memorial services" for Park Chung-Hee, former ill-famed dictator of "yusin" 34 years since he was shot to death.
					 In this regard, the Secretariat of the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea (CPRK) issued its information bulletin No. 1049 on Thursday.
					
					 It said:
					
					 The "Saenuri Party" and conservative group let loose a string of balderdash that "the era of the yusin was better than the present" and " dictatorship is necessary" at the "memorial services" held in "Hyonchung Temple", Seoul and Kumi, North Kyongsang Province, the birthplace of Park Chung-Hee, on that day.
					
					 They also asserted that the "May 16 Military Coup was a decision for national salvation," praising the "yusin" dictator to the sky. They went the lengths of blustering that they would certainly achieve together with Park Geun Hye what was wished by him to attain.
					
					 The puppet conservative group's disgusting farces are anachronistic foolish acts contrary to the trend of the times and an unpardonable mockery and challenge to the south Koreans and all other compatriots.
					
					 There was no such precedent in which a dictator met such a miserable end, forsaken by all the people, as what Park Chung-Hee did, the bulletin noted, and went on:
					
					 Even today the south Korean people are troubled with the nightmare in those times whenever they hear the word of the "yusin".
					
					 The conservative group staged such ruckuses as extolling Park Chung-Hee and embellishing his "yusin" dictatorship, instead of feeling ashamed of the wicked dictator who met a tragic death, cursed by all Koreans. They clearly indicate what ferocious fascists and dictators they are.
					
					 What is happening in different parts of south Korea at present is that the departed soul of "yusin" has been brought back, the fascist dictatorship is riding roughshod, the remnants of the "yusin" and their descendents are running riot as if the days of their glory had returned and various farces are taking place to praise "yusin."
					
					 Legitimate political parties and progressive organizations and figures are being cruelly cracked down on charge of "following the north" and political freedom, democratic rights and elementary right to existence and human rights of people wantonly violated due to the politics of intelligence and the politics of terror.
					
					 The recent farces are a vivid manifestation of the moves to revive the "yusin" dictatorship and part of the campaign to praise the "yusin" dictator.
					
					 It is as clear as pikestaff that if such foolish acts of the puppet conservative group reminiscent of neo-Nazis are allowed to go on, there will come back to south Korea the medieval dark era of fascist rule harsher than Park's "yusin" dictatorship. 
					
					 It is great misfortune and shame  for south Korea to go back to the era of the "yusin" dictatorship quite contrary to the trend of the  times, concluded the bulletin.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Denounced for Abusing Sports for Inciting Confrontation
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Denounced for Abusing Sports for Inciting Confrontation 
 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- The spokesman for the National Reconciliation Council released a statement Friday in connection with the fact that the south Korean puppet forces fanned up anti-DPRK hysteria even in the sports sector, enraging the people.
					 At a sports contest in Inchon, Kyonggi Province, south Korea a short time ago, the puppet forces formed "players' team of five provinces of the north" with human scum who deserted their homeland and fled to the south.
					
					 What should not be overlooked is that the south Korean chief executive addressed the contest, unaware of where to draw the line.
					
					 This act of hostility toward the DPRK going against sports spirit aspiring after justice and peace and the desire for national reconciliation and unity is a serious politically-motivated provocation against the DPRK and an intolerable mockery of its dignity and social system, the spokesman said, and went on:
					
					 The National Reconciliation Council vehemently denounces this as a vicious and despicable confrontational rowdyism aimed to oppose national reconciliation and unity and to push the north-south ties into irrevocable catastrophe on behalf of all the Koreans.
					
					 All the Koreans are strongly calling for normalizing the north-south ties at an early date and achieving the unity of the nation in the basic spirit of "By our nation itself" stated in the north-south joint declarations.
					
					 But the grave anti-DPRK acts that take place on a daily basis in south Korea arouse serious concerns about the prospect for the north-south ties.
					
					 It is something abnormal to form the "players' team of five provinces of the north" with those who deserted their families and homes and betrayed the party and homeland which brought them up.
					
					 That's why they are snubbed and rejected even in south Korea, being branded as betrayers and traitors.
					
					 The chief executive, who emitted venom by delivering even an "address", is a good match for them.
					
					 She spoke loudly of "confidence-building" before the public at home and abroad but behind the scene she incited confrontation, patronizing human scum. This leaves the people skeptical about the future of the north-south ties.
					
					 A special mention should be made of the anti-DPRK farce that was staged in a stadium in Inchon, venue of the 17th Asian Games.
					
					 The puppet forces insulted sports whose mission is sound mental and physical training for harmony, unity, justice and peace. This casts doubt on the successful hosting of the games next year.
					
					 There is no vouch that the games will not be a theatre for inciting hostility toward the DPRK in the light of the present situation in south Korea and the wicked mind of the puppet forces.
					
					 We will never tolerate the puppet forces' act of abusing sacred sports for escalating confrontation with fellow countrymen.
					
					 We will follow the attitude of the south Korean authorities.

articles.title: Report on Mongolian President's Visit to DPRK
articles.content:
Report on Mongolian President's Visit to DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- Mongolian President Tsakhiagiin Elbegdorj visited the DPRK from Oct. 28 to 31, Juche 102 (2013) at the invitation of Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly (SPA). 
					 During his visit the talks between Kim Yong Nam and the Mongolian president took place and the DPRK Cabinet premier and the chairman of the SPA separately met and conversed with the Mongolian president. 
					
					 At the talks and conversations they informed each other of the situations in their countries and had a candid exchange of views on the issue of boosting the DPRK-Mongolia friendly and cooperative relations with a long history and tradition and matters of mutual concern and reached a consensus of views on all issues discussed. They concluded a series of agreements. 
					
					 Both sides stressed that the Mongolian president's visit to the DPRK marked an important occasion in opening a new chapter in the development of the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation provided by the preceding leaders as it took place in the significant year marking the 65th anniversary of the opening of diplomatic ties between the two countries and the 25th anniversary of President Kim Il Sung's Mongolia visit. 
					
					 The DPRK side congratulated the Mongolian government and people on achieving socio-political stability, keeping a high rate of economic growth depending on its rich natural resources and raising its international position by pursuing independent and multi-faceted foreign policies under the correct guidance of the Mongolian president. It wished the Mongolian people bigger successes in their efforts to build a rich and powerful state. 
					
					 The Mongolian side congratulated the Korean people on celebrating with splendor the 65th anniversary of the DPRK and the diamond jubilee of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War, successfully tiding over difficulties under the wise leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un. It expressed support and solidarity for the Korean people in their struggle to achieve prosperity and independent and peaceful reunification of the country. 
					
					 Both sides stressed the need to independently and steadily boost the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation in all fields including politics, economy, culture, sports and tourism on the principle of mutual respect, equality and non-interference in internal affairs and in the common interests. 
					
					 Both sides appreciated that the agreements on cooperation in the fields of industry, agriculture, culture, sports and tourism signed between the governments of the two countries this time are of weighty significance in putting the bilateral cooperation on a new stage. 
					
					 Both sides had an in-depth discussion on ways of extensively developing economic and trade relations and facilitating multi-faceted exchange and cooperation by making a maximum use of the close historical bonds between the two countries and the rich potential for cooperation and thereby bringing substantial benefits to the two peoples. 
					
					 They decided to cooperate with each other on the basis of exchanging the successes and experience gained in the process of socio-economic development and respecting the right to choice in each other's social system and development and make positive efforts in the direction of creating a legal environment favorable for finance and investment according to domestic law and regulations and the internationally recognized principles and norms.
					
					 They recognized in union that to boost the traditional bilateral relations of friendship and cooperation with the geographical and historical commonness is in line with the desire and wishes of the two peoples and it is conducive to the peace and stability in Northeast Asia and the rest of the world.
					
					 The Mongolian side explained the "Ulaanbaatar Dialogue" on security in Northeast Asia proposed by the Mongolian president and the DPRK side took note of it and said that it would respect Mongolia's status as a non-nuclear state.
					
					 It was decided that both sides would hold regular negotiations between the foreign ministers of the two countries every year and closely cooperate with each other at the UN General Assembly and other international conferences.
					
					 The Mongolian president's visit to the DPRK will give strong spurs to boosting the DPRK-Mongolia friendship with a long history and tradition and dynamically promote the multi-faceted exchange and cooperation between the two countries.

articles.title: Indonesian Lawmakers Delegation Here
articles.content:
Indonesian Lawmakers Delegation Here
						
 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the People's Consultative Assembly of Indonesia led by Speaker Sidarto Danusubroto arrived here on Friday.
					 It was greeted at the airport by Choe Thae Bok, chairman of the Supreme People's Assembly (SPA) of the DPRK, Kil Chol Hyok, deputy to the SPA, officials concerned, Nasri Gustaman, Indonesian ambassador to the DPRK, and staff members of his embassy here.

articles.title: Indonesian Lawmakers Feted
articles.content:
Indonesian Lawmakers Feted
 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- The DPRK Supreme People's Assembly (SPA) gave a reception in honor of the visiting delegation of the People's Consultative Assembly of Indonesia led by Speaker Sidarto Danusubroto at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Friday.
					 Present there on invitation were the head and members of the delegation and Indonesian Ambassador to the DPRK Nasri Gustaman.
					
					 Present there were SPA Chairman Choe Thae Bok, SPA Vice-Chairman Kim Wan Su, Kil Chol Hyok, Kim Yong Nam, Mun Sang Min and Kim Song Hi, deputies to the SPA, and officials concerned. 
					
					 Choe Thae Bok spoke at the reception.
					
					 He referred to the fact that the Indonesian people have made energetic efforts to build a prosperous country.
					
					 The friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and Indonesia are steadily growing under the deep care of the leaders of the two countries, he said, expressing belief that the relations between the two countries would develop in various fields in the future, too.
					
					 Sidarto Danusubroto spoke next.
					
					 He said he visited the DPRK to broaden the development of the bilateral relations, expressing deep thanks to the DPRK side for hospitality.
					
					 He noted he witnessed that the DPRK people made great achievements in several fields.
					
					 He showed his will to contribute to the improvement of the long-standing bilateral relations.

articles.title: Pyongyang University of Dramatic, Cinematic Arts
articles.content:
Pyongyang University of Dramatic, Cinematic Arts
 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- Today marks the 60th anniversary of Pyongyang University of Dramatic and Cinematic Arts.
					 The university is a comprehensive center for training dramatic artistes and movie-persons.
					
					 In this regard, Han Yun Nam, vice-rector in charge of school affairs of the university, told KCNA:
					
					 The history of our university is associated with the loving care of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 It was founded as an art school attached to the National Theatre on November 1, Juche 42 (1953), on the initiative of the President, and later developed into Pyongyang Art School, National Dramatic School and then the present university.
					
					 The President showed deep care for the university, taking measures for the construction of a new building and the provision of educational equipment.
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il gave meticulous guidance over the development of the university.
					
					 In the 1970s when the university was resorting to the outdated drama education, divorced from the actual situation, he made public a work "On Thoroughly Applying the Principles of Socialist Pedagogy in Education in the Cinema", indicating the path to be followed by the Juche art education.
					
					 He also took a measure to set up at the university a youth film production group whose mission is to ensure on-site education for students and produce films conducive to educating the young people.
					
					 As intended by him, the university properly combined theoretical education and creative activities, thus producing such films of high ideological and artistic value as feature film "The Bride from the City".
					
					 It turned out famous film actors and actresses who played leading parts in "A Schoolgirl's Diary", "Pyongyang Nalpharam", "Lovely Sunshine" and many other feature films.
					
					 It also produced noted film directors, photographers and drama stars who greatly contributed to the production of many masterpieces, including revolutionary drama "Following the Banner of Victory", revolutionary film "The Land in Flames", multi-part feature film "The Nation and Destiny", light comedy "An Echo among the Hills" and drama "We Will Recollect Today", winners of Kim Il Sung Prize.
					
					 The university made public books, textbooks and reference books of 350-odd kinds, including "Library of the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung's Juche-based Idea of the Arts and Literature ", "Library of the Great Leader Comrade Kim Jong Il's Juche-oriented Theory of Literature and Art", "Theory on Drama Creation" and "Composition of Film Play".
					
					 The university has produced hundreds of holders of state honorary titles and academic degrees.

articles.title: New Dwelling Houses Built in Kosan Fruit Farm
articles.content:
New Dwelling Houses Built in Kosan Fruit Farm
						
 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- An event of moving into new houses took place in the Kosan Fruit Farm in Kangwon Province, the DPRK.
					 The Construction Shock Brigade 618 has finished building the 510 houses in a matter of one year.
					
					 Each of the white tile-roofed houses has two or three living rooms and a storehouse and a cage.
					
					 Yu Hwang Chol, an official in charge of stock-breeding of the farm, told KCNA:
					
					 Kosan area has remarkably changed in a few years.
					
					 My family, too, moved into a new house. 
					
					 This event makes me sorely miss leader Kim Jong Il, who visited the farm two years ago to encourage us to boost the fruit production.
					
					 I will devote all my efforts to further developing the cyclic production system between fruit and stock farming, so as to uphold the leadership of the respected Marshal Kim Jong Un with loyalty, true to the behest of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Jong Il Bom, a worker of the farm, said:
					
					 Kosan area has turned into one of the country's major fruit producers, with modern dwelling houses standing in a row at the foot of the mountain.
					
					 Kim Ju Song, a worker, said:
					
					 My family members are very pleased to have a new house.
					
					 All the people in the Kosan area are willing to repay the deep concern of the Workers' Party of Korea for the farm with increased fruit production.

articles.title: Signal Technological Innovations at Machine Complex
articles.content:
Signal Technological Innovations at Machine Complex
						
 Chongjin, November 1 (KCNA) -- A high-pitched technological innovation drive is under way at the Ranam Coal-mining Machine Complex in North Hamgyong Province.
					 More than 60 valuable technological innovation proposals have been introduced into production at the complex this year.
					
					 Workers, technicians at the coal mining machine shop and members of the three-revolution team developed a new method of processing main cylinder of hydraulic press and contrived an efficient grinding machine and introduced them into production by pooling their creative wisdom. 
					
					 The chain production shop applied a new covering material into the production of welding rods, remarkably improving the quality of welding metal.
					
					 The chain conveyor shop introduced an efficient jig into a cone-shaped curve gear processor, ensuring high accuracy in processing machine parts.
					
					 The winch shop, power shop, daily necessaries shop and various other shops introduced a lot of technological innovation proposals into production.
					
					 The complex is now channeling sustained big efforts into the projects for successfully solving technological issues arising in production and updating production processes.

articles.title: Family Good at Stockbreeding
articles.content:
Family Good at Stockbreeding
						
 Sariwon, November 1 (KCNA) -- In Sariwon City, North Hwanghae Province of the DPRK, there is Jo Sun Ok's family, well known in the country for its successful stockbreeding.
					 The family set about livestock raising four years ago with the aim of doing a good thing for the country.
					
					 Solving by its own efforts all problems arising in stockbreeding such as provision of piglets, fodder and veterinary medicines, the family has raised dozens of pigs every year. It donated a large quantity of meat to the servicepersons in April last year.
					
					 This year the family has built several pigpens to raise more pigs while introducing advanced methods to fat up them.
					
					 Jo Sun Ok told KCNA that her family would strive to increase the pork production for servicepersons as well as for the improvement of its livelihood.

articles.title: Legends about Mt. Kumgang (2)
articles.content:
Legends about Mt. Kumgang (2)
 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- White broad bellflower growing in Okryudong Valley in Mt. Kumgang tells about a legend well known among the local people.
					 Once upon a time, there was an old man surnamed To, who was living in the valley with his daughter, Ra Ji.
					
					 They lived a poor life, up to the ears in debt To owed to a rich man for the funeral of Ra Ji's mother three years ago.
					
					 The rich man urged To to pay the debt at an early date, while harboring an evil heart for Ra Ji.
					
					 One day, the rich man called To and forced him to seal a contract stipulating that the money-lender shall take away To's daughter as his mistress if the debtor failed to pay the debt until the 3rd anniversary of his wife's death.
					
					 Upon hearing the news, Ra Ji went to the rich man with the contract document in her hand.
					
					 She tore it off in his face, saying she would do as the contract said.
					
					 Later, on the way to the rich man's house in a palanquin, she killed herself by throwing her body over a steep cliff. 
					
					 After her death, there appeared a small grave with a white flower on it near her mother's. 
					
					 Hence, the villagers began to call the white flower "Toraji" (broad bellflower) after her name and sowed the flower seed all over the mountain from next year.

articles.title: Security Chief of Chongwadae Denounced for Entreating U.S. for Cooperation against DPRK
articles.content:
Security Chief of Chongwadae Denounced for Entreating U.S. for Cooperation against DPRK
 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Jang Su, chief of the Security Office of Chongwadae of south Korea, during his recent visit to the U.S. met the U.S. secretaries of State and Defense, the assistant to the President for National Security of the White House and others to ask for "cooperation in settling the north's nuclear issue". He cried out for the "necessity of the north's change of attitude" and "adjustment of the period of transfer of wartime operation control". 
					 This clearly revealed the despicable nature of the puppet group of south Korea keen on the moves to hurt the fellow countrymen in reliance on outside forces, says Minju Joson Friday in a commentary.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 Kim Jang Su's hackneyed remarks about "cooperation in settling the north's nuclear issue" before his masters reflected uneasiness and anxiousness of the south Korean puppet group in fear of the improvement of the DPRK-U.S. relations. 
					
					 The clear intention of the south Korean group in raising the signboard of "cooperation in settling the north's nuclear issue" is to keep the U.S. from advancing toward the improvement of the DPRK-U.S. relations.
					
					 The same is the case with the "necessity of the north's change of attitude" claimed by him as he asked for re-extension of the period of transfer of wartime operation control. 
					
					 It is the reckless behavior which can be done only by the traitors hell-bent on hurting the fellow countrymen, backed by the U.S. 
					
					 In a word, Kim Jang Su's U.S. visit was a mendicant trip to escalate confrontation with the fellow countrymen. 
					
					 He got the cold shoulder from his U.S. superiors though he fawned on them by letting loose reckless remarks tarnishing the dignity of the nation. 
					
					 It is too natural that he, who serves the U.S. as a colonial puppet, experienced the hot agony of shame as he tried to do harm to the fellow countrymen who are working hard to preserve and glorify the dignity of the nation.

articles.title: S. Korean Warmongers Kick Off War Maneuvers against DPRK
articles.content:
S. Korean Warmongers Kick Off War Maneuvers against DPRK 
 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- The 17th Division of the south Korean puppet army kicked off the war maneuvers to mount a surprise attack on the DPRK from October 24 to 30 as part of the Hoguk exercises.
					 The warmongers incited a war fever by staging trainings for counterattack operation and recovery of combat power, talking about non-existent "southward invasion by the north". The military exercises were staged in collaboration with the Second Marine Division of the puppet army.
					
					 The warmongers are busy watching for a chance to mount a preemptive attack on the DPRK while staging the Hoguk exercises despite the strong protest and denunciation at home and abroad.

articles.title: S. Korean Court's Unreasonable Verdict Assailed
articles.content:
S. Korean Court's Unreasonable Verdict Assailed
						
 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- Organizations related to the May 18 Popular Uprising in south Korea including the May 18 Council of Bereaved Families of Men of Merits for Democracy released a statement on October 30 denouncing a puppet court's unreasonable verdict defending the conservatives who insulted the uprising.
					 That day the Taegu District Court passed a verdict of "not guilty" on those of die-hard conservative organization who insulted the uprising, the statement said.
					
					 It accused these ruffians of sparking off big furor by posting on websites articles alleging the May 18 Kwangju resistance was staged at the instruction and wire-pulling of "leftist" forces and "special unit of the north".
					
					 The verdict made by the court is an illegal one and a challenge to the movement for democracy, it charged. It is as good as driving nails into the hearts of the participants in the resistance and bereaved families.
					
					 The statement condemned the "government" authorities for shielding the conservative forces that defamed the honor of the participants in the uprising.

articles.title: Actions against Moves to Revive "Yusin" Dictatorship Urged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Actions against Moves to Revive "Yusin" Dictatorship Urged in S. Korea
						
 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- The south Korean internet newspaper Voice of People in an editorial Monday called for driving those who push for reviving the "yusin" dictatorship beyond the fringes of history.
					 The editorial accused the "Saenuri Party" and other conservative forces of letting loose such string of rigmaroles praising traitor Park Chung-Hee as claiming that the "era of yusin was better than the present" and "there should be dictatorship" at the "memorial services" held in Seoul and Kumi of North Kyongsang Province on October 26. 
					
					 The editorial rapped the secretary general of the "Saenuri Party" for blustering that "it should remain in power for 20 years to come". 
					
					 All these facts disclose the ulterior intention of the conservative authorities to pursue a dictatorial rule in the future, it noted, and continued:
					
					 However, this is no more than a daydream. The south Korean people are no longer what they used to be in the days when Park Chung-Hee waged the "new village movement."
					
					 Park Geun Hye's moves to revive the "yusin" dictatorship are bound to go bust just as Park Chung-Hee "yusin" system ended in a tragedy.
					
					 The advance of history is unthinkable apart from struggles. The Korean Confederation of Trade Unions has an important duty to perform in these struggles. 
					
					 Only when the workers turn out in strong actions as an organized force, will the departed soul of "yusin" disappear and a new day of democracy dawn.

articles.title: Bird Flu Occurs in S. Korea
articles.content:
Bird Flu Occurs in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- Bird flu occurred in South Kyongsang and South Jolla provinces, according to south Korean KBS on Oct. 31.
					 Bird flu virus was detected in excrement of migratory birds and chickens in those areas. 
					
					 The bird flu has occurred in south Korea several times so far, causing damages amounting to six hundred billion won.

articles.title: DPRK's Significant Days in October Observed in Various Countries
articles.content:
DPRK's Significant Days in October Observed in Various Countries
						
 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- Progressive humankind significantly marked the 16th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's election as general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK), the 68th anniversary of the WPK and the 87th anniversary of the Down-with-Imperialism Union (DIU).
					 Marshal Kim Jong Un received congratulatory messages from heads of political parties and states on the occasion of the 68th anniversary of the WPK.
					
					 They included the chairman of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party who is president of the Lao People's Democratic Republic, president of the Syrian Arab Republic and the coordinator of the National Coordinating Committee of the Workers' Party of Mexico.
					
					 Kim Jong Un was presented with gifts by Chinese and Russian businessmen.
					
					 The Central Committee of the WPK received a floral basket from the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China.
					
					 Figures of political parties and organizations in various countries paid congratulatory visits to the DPRK missions in their countries or sent floral baskets and bouquets to them.
					
					 They included the deputy prime minister and foreign minister of Laos who is member of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party and chairman of the Committee for External Affairs of the party, first secretary of the Khabarovsk Territorial Committee of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Nepal Communist Party (Marxist-Leninist) and the chairman of the Bangladesh Group for the Study of the Songun Policy.
					
					 The top prize of exhibits and top prize of designs were awarded to Kimilsungia and Kimjongilia, immortal flowers of the sun, at the 8th China Flower Expo held in Jiangsu Province.
					
					 Progressive political parties and organizations in different countries and figures of all social strata in their statements and talks praised the immortal leadership exploits performed by President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il in the party building and expressed belief that the WPK led by another illustrious commander would demonstrate its might as the eternal party of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Progressive humankind joined the Korean people in significantly celebrating the 68th anniversary of the WPK by holding colorful events including Kimjongilia shows, meetings, seminars and books and photo exhibitions.
					
					 In different countries works of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il and Kim Jong Un were published in booklet or carried by newspapers or aired by radio and TV broadcasting services or posted on websites to mark the significant day.
					
					 Those works included "3. Let Us Reunify the Country Independently and Peacefully" from "Report to the Sixth Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea on the Work of the Central Committee", "On the Fundamentals of Revolutionary Party Building" and "Let Us Step Up the Building of a Thriving Country by Applying Kim Jong Il's Patriotism."
					
					 The Revolutionary Communist Party of Britain (Marxist-Leninist) produced a documentary film "Peace and 60 years of Single-minded Unity" dealing with the military parade and Pyongyang mass demonstration to mark the 60th anniversary of the victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War and the invincible might and real picture of Songun Korea.
					
					 Foreign media carried special write-ups titled "WPK shining with august names of peerlessly great men", "Great leader of mother party" and "Source of WPK's invincibility" illustrated with photos documenting the undying feats performed by the great men of Mt. Paektu in founding and strengthening the WPK.

articles.title: DPRK's Building of Highly Civilized Nation Introduced by Nigerian Organization
articles.content:
DPRK's Building of Highly Civilized Nation Introduced by Nigerian Organization
 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea posted an article titled "Highly Civilized Socialist Country" on its website on Oct. 21.
					  The DPRK is putting spurs to building a highly civilized country while building an economic power, the article said, and went on:
					
					 It is the intention of supreme leader Kim Jong Un to usher in the period of efflorescence of high civilization in the 21st century by energetically accelerating the construction of a highly civilized socialist country.
					
					 The DPRK has already reached a considerably high level in civilization.
					
					 It has become a manufacturer and launcher of satellites and equipped economic sectors with state-of-the-art technologies. The level of education in the DPRK can be judged by the high level of development of science and technology. 
					
					 It is the firm will of the Workers' Party of Korea to fully provide all the Korean people with a highly civilized life in the new century by placing all fields on the level of a power with high civilization.
					
					 The universal compulsory 11 year education system has been replaced by the universal compulsory 12 year education system, free healthcare has been put on a higher level and a great progress made in the development of sports throughout the country.
					
					 People's conditions for cultural life are improving as the days go by as required by the new century and the growing desire of the people as evidenced by the facts that new dwelling houses and modern facilities for cultural and emotional life are springing up one after another in Pyongyang and other cities and rural areas.
					
					 The DPRK has a bright prospect for enabling its people to enjoy the most civilized life.

articles.title: Letter to Kim Jong Un from Koreans' Organization in Russia
articles.content:
Letter to Kim Jong Un from Koreans' Organization in Russia
						
 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un Wednesday received a letter from the Central Association of Korean Nationals in Russia on the occasion of the 20th anniversary of the association.
					 The letter noted that it was entirely thanks to the deep love and trust of leader Kim Jong Il that the association, the overseas citizens' organization of the dignified socialist homeland of Juche, invariably covered the road of patriotism and loyalty for the past 20 years, convinced that President Kim Il Sung is always with them.
					
					 Marshal Kim Jong Un has led to victory only the continued confrontation with the U.S. imperialists and their followers and wisely steered the drive to build a socialist economic power and a highly civilized nation with his matchless rare insight, strong pluck and distinguished political caliber, winning the great admiration of the world people, it said.
					
					 It reiterated the will to further develop the association into the overseas citizens' organization of Juche Korea which trusts and follows Kim Jong Un, the most illustrious commander, in any adversity, with the honor and pride of being overseas citizens having him as the supreme leader of the DPRK.

articles.title: Hungarian Political Party Accuses S. Korean Authorities of Suppressing Progressive Party
articles.content:
Hungarian Political Party Accuses S. Korean Authorities of Suppressing Progressive Party
 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- The Hungarian Workers' Party issued a statement on Sunday in denunciation of the south Korean authorities' moves to dissolve the Unified Progressive Party (UPP) by force.
					 The statement said:
					
					 The Hungarian Workers' Party denounces the south Korean conservative group, deeply concerned about its moves to disband the UPP. The group instigated the puppet Ministry of Justice to set up the "special team for measures against unconstitutional political parties and organizations" and examine the bill concerning the dissolution of the UPP and decided to carry the case to the "Constitutional Court" while inviting lawyers.
					
					 We regard these moves as the fascist oppression unprecedented in the world history.
					
					 The freedom and right to activities of the political parties are guaranteed in all countries around the world.
					
					 Quite contrary to the trend of the present times, the conservative group is suppressing the progressive forces to remove their core members and undermine all the forces advocating the reunification in alliance with the north and the democratic reform. This is aimed at laying a springboard for longer stay in office.
					
					 The grave situation in south Korea vividly shows that the present authorities are heinous confrontation elements standing against the national reunification, putting the past military dictators into the shade.
					
					 We appeal to all the progressive political parties and people in south Korea to wage a dynamic fight against the conservative group.

articles.title: DPRK-Mongolia Friendship and Cooperation Introduced by Mongolian Internet News
articles.content:
DPRK-Mongolia Friendship and Cooperation Introduced by Mongolian Internet News
						
 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- The Mongolian internet news Info Mongolia posted a special write-up on Monday under the title "History of Friendly Relations between Mongolia and the DPRK".
					 The special write-up was illustrated with a photo of President Kim Il Sung receiving Zh. Sambuu, former chairman of the Presidium of the Great People's Khural, on a visit to the DPRK in 1961, and a photo the President had taken with Korean children when he was visiting Mongolia after the Korean war.
					
					 The year 2013 marks the 65th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic ties between Mongolia and the DPRK, the news said, introducing in detail the bilateral relations of friendship and cooperation.
					
					 The improvement of the Mongolia-DPRK relations is unthinkable without the President, the news said, elaborating on his relations with Zh. Sambuu, former chairman of the Presidium of the Great People's Khural and former Mongolian ambassador to the DPRK, and J. Tsevelma and O. Cherma who were teachers of the Mongolian School of Korean War Orphans.
					
					 The governments and peoples of the two countries have helped and supported each other and boosted cooperation in several fields. The bilateral relations are steadily improving in the interests of the two peoples under the deep care of the leaders of both countries, the news added.

articles.title: Premier coreano recorre campo de construccion de estacion no. 621 de mejoramiento de variedades
articles.content:
Premier coreano recorre campo de construccion de estacion no. 621 de mejoramiento de variedades
						
Pyongyang, 1 de noviembre (ACNC) -- El premier de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Pak Pong Ju, hizo conocimiento del estado de la construccion de segunda etapa de la estacion no.621 del mejoramiento de variedades del Ejercito Popular de Corea.
					Pasando revista a los objetos de primera etapa erguidos por la propuesta y la dinamica direccion del Mariscal Kim Jong Un, averiguo de modo detallado el estado de la obra y cria de animales domesticos de buena variedad.
					
					Se convoco en el terreno la reunion consultiva de los funcionarios de la rama correspondiente, ocasion en la cual fueron definidos los objetos a ser construidos por cada periodo para cumplir la meta de construccion de segunda etapa segun el proposito del partido y se discutieron las medidas para suministrar con satisfaccion los materiales e instalaciones.
					
					La meseta de Sepho se convierte en una gran base ganadera y se levanta rapido la base de mejoramiento de variedad, dijo y enfatizo que las unidades relacionadas deben cumplir con su responsabilidad y papel.

articles.title: CRPP condena elogio a Park Chung Hee en Sur de Corea
articles.content:
CRPP condena elogio a Park Chung Hee en Sur de Corea
						
Pyongyang, 1 de noviembre (ACNC) -- El pasado dia 26, la banda de conservadores titeres del Sur de Corea organizo una "ceremonia de recordacion" a Park Chung Hee, ex infame dictador de "Yusin" (renovacion) con motivo del 34o aniversario de su fusilamiento.
					Al respecto, el secretariado del Comite por la Reunificacion Pacifica de la Patria (CRPP) hizo publica el 31 de octubre una informacion no. 1049.
					
					Ese dia, los compinches conservadores del "Partido Saenuri" que acudieron a la "ceremonia de recordacion", efectuada "Hyonchungwon" de Seul y en Kumi de la provincia de Kyongsang del Norte, tierra natal de aquel dictador, dijeron que "fue mejor la epoca de Yusin" y que "es necesaria la dictadura", senala la nota y prosigue:
					
					Al elogiar mucho al ex dictador calificaron sin vacilacion alguna el golpe del 16 de mayo de "una decision para salvar la patria" y declararon que "construiran sin falta junto con Park Geun-hye lo que queria su padre".
					
					Esta conducta maligna deviene una accion anacronica que contraviene a la corriente de la epoca, burla y desafio intolerables a los habitantes surcoreanos y todos los demas coreanos.
					
					El ex dictador de "renovacion" sufrio el fin tragico sin precedente siendo abandonado por toda la nacion.
					
					Hoy dia tambien, los surcoreanos se tiemblan por miedo cuando se oye siquiera la palabra "Yusin".
					
					En lugar de sentir verguenza por aquel dictador, los conservadores titeres le encomian y embellecen su dictadura de "Yusin", lo cual muestra que ellos son los maniacos fascistas y dictatoriales.
					
					En la actualidad en el suelo surcoreano reina la dictadura fascista y los restantes y descendientes de "Yusin" actuan como si fueran duenos organizando en todos los lugares los actos de elogio a la "renovacion".
					
					Los partidos politicos y entidades progresistas legales y las personalidades son reprimidos brutalmente acusados de "fuerzas pro-Norte",  pisoteados la libertad politica y el derecho democratico de los habitantes y violados despiadadamente el derecho a sobrevivir y los derechos humanos basicos debido a la politica de inteligencia y terror.
					
					Los presentes actos de elogio a Park Chung Hee resultan una muestra concentrada y prolongacion de las maniobras de revitalizacion de dictadura de "renovacion".
					
					Si se toleran tales conductas de los conservadores surcoreanos, iguales a nuevos nacistas, en el Sur de Corea reinara una epoca oscura de dictadura fascista medieval, mas peor que la dictadura de "renovacion" practicada por Park Chung Hee.
					
					Para el Sur de Corea es una gran desgracia y verguenza volver a la era de dictadura de "renovacion" en contra de la corriente de la epoca.

articles.title: Sur de Corea malemplea el deporte en enfrentamiento con RPDC,  senala CRN
articles.content:
Sur de Corea malemplea el deporte en enfrentamiento con RPDC,  senala CRN
						
Pyongyang, 1 de noviembre (ACNC) -- En estos dias, la campana conflictiva de los conservadores surcoreanos contra la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea se extiende hasta al sector deportivo dejando consternado a todo el mundo. 
					Al respecto, el portavoz del Consejo de Reconciliacion Nacional (CRN) hizo publica el dia primero la siguiente declaracion:
					
					Hace poco, los titeres surcoreanos realizaron en Inchon de la provincia de Kyonggi la llamada "competencia deportiva nacional" y orquestaron la participacion del "equipo de jugadores provenientes de 5 provincias norcoreanas", compuesto por los traidores que se fugaron al Sur de Corea, y otra chusma. 
					
					Lo mas grave del caso es que la mandataria surcoreana se porto mal en esa ocasion pronunciando el "discurso de apertura". 
					
					Este abierto acto hostil anti-RPDC, que contraviene al espiritu deportivo en pro de la justicia y la paz, la reconciliacion y unidad nacionales, resulta otra grave provocacion politica e intolerable insulto a la dignidad y regimen de la RPDC. 
					
					El CRN denuncia categoricamente en nombre de toda la nacion esa locura conflictiva de los titeres surcoreanos que rechazan la reconciliacion y unidad nacionales y llevan a la fase irremediable las relaciones intercoreanas. 
					
					Ahora toda la nacion exige fuertemente que se normalicen lo mas pronto posible las relaciones entre ambas partes coreanas y se logre la unidad nacional segun el espiritu principal de "Entre nosotros, los connacionales", ideal indicado en la Declaracion Conjunta Norte-Sur del 15 de Junio. 
					
					Pero, los graves actos hostiles anti-RPDC, que se cometen diariamente en suelo surcoreano, causan seria preocupacion sobre las perspectivas de las relaciones intercoreanas. 
					
					Nadie considerara como normal la aparicion del citado "equipo", integrado por las escorias humanas que abandonaron a sus familias y tierras natales y traicionaron al partido y la patria que les ha criado. 
					
					Ellos son repudiados y rechazados como traidores hasta en suelo surcoreano. 
					
					Son iguales esos fulanos y menganos, que participaron en la competencia deportiva bajo el cartel del "equipo", y la mandataria surcoreana que pronuncio el "discurso de apertura" en esa farsa. 
					
					La opinion publica interna y externa esta preocupada del futuro de las relaciones Norte-Sur observando con compasion a la mandataria surcoreana que habla tanto del "establecimiento de la confianza", por una parte y por la otra, recurre a la confrontacion fratricida andando con basuras humanas. 
					
					En particular, llama la atencion el hecho de que la presente farsa conflictiva anti-RPDC tuvo lugar en el estadio de Inchon, sede de los XVII Juegos Asiaticos. 
					
					Entenebrece la apertura exitosa de esos juegos internacionales la actitud de los titeres surcoreanos que insultan el espiritu deportivo de fomentar el sano espiritu y la constitucion fisica de las personas y aspirar a la reconciliacion, la unidad, la justicia y la paz. 
					
					Al tener en consideracion la realidad actual del Sur de Corea y las malas entranas de los titeres surcoreanos, nadie puede garantizar que no se repetira el caso semejante en esa cita deportiva, programada para el proximo ano. 
					
					No podemos tolerar jamas tal comportamiento de la camarilla titere del Sur de Corea. 
					
					Observaremos atentamente la postura ulterior de las autoridades surcoreanas.

articles.title: Publicada informacion sobre la visita del presidente mongol a RPDC
articles.content:
Publicada informacion sobre la visita del presidente mongol a RPDC
Pyongyang, 1 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Su Excelencia Tsakhiagiin Elbegdorj, presidente de Mongolia realizo del 28 al 31 de octubre del 102 (2013) de la Era Juche una visita a la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea cumplimentando la invitacion del presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la RPDC, Kim Yong Nam.
					Durante la visita, tuvieron lugar las conversaciones entre Kim Yong Nam y Tsakhiagiin Elbegdorj; el premier y el presidente de la APS de la RPDC se reunieron por separado con el visitante.
					
					En esas ocasiones, informaron las situaciones de los respectivos paises e intercambiaron los criterios sinceros sobre los problemas de interes mutuo, tales como desarrollar mas las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre la RPDC y Mongolia con larga historia y tradicion. Llegaron al consenso en todos los problemas abordados y firmaron varios convenios.
					
					Ambas partes senalaron que la visita del presidente de Mongolia, realizada en este ano significativo del 65o aniversario del establecimiento de relaciones diplomaticas de los dos paises y del 25o de la visita del Presidente Kim Il Sung a Mongolia, devino una ocasion importante para abrir la nueva pagina del desarrollo de tradicionales relaciones de amistad y cooperacion preparadas por los lideres antecesores.
					
					La parte coreana felicito el hecho de que bajo la correcta guia del presidente, el gobierno y el pueblo de Mongolia lograron la estabilidad socio-politica, mantienen el alto indice de crecimiento economico con abundantes recursos naturales y elevan su posicion internacional practicando la politica exterior independiente y multilateral. Y deseo que el pueblo de Mongolia obtenga mayores exitos en su lucha por levantar un Estado prospero.
					
					La parte de Mongolia felicito al pueblo coreano que bajo la sabia orientacion del Mariscal Kim Jong Un, celebro solemnemente el 65o aniversario de la fundacion de la RPDC y el 60o aniversario de la victoria en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria superando con exito las dificultades. Manifesto el apoyo y la solidaridad a la lucha del pueblo coreano por lograr la prosperidad del pais y la reunificacion independiente y pacifica de la patria.
					
					Ambas partes destacaron la necesidad de desarrollar sin parar las tradicionales relaciones bilaterales de acuerdo con los intereses mutuos y de manera independiente en todas las esferas, inclusive la politica, la economia, la cultura, el deporte y el turismo, observando los principios de respeto mutuo, igualdad y la no intervencion en asuntos internos. 
					
					Ambas partes estimaron que los presentes acuerdos intergubernamentales sobre la cooperacion en la industria, la agricultura, la cultura, el deporte y el turismo revisten gran importancia para llevar a una nueva etapa la cooperacion entre los dos paises. 
					
					Discutieron con profundidad los remedios para desarrollar ampliamente las relaciones economicas y comerciales poniendo de pleno manifiesto los estrechos lazos historicos y grandes potencialidades de cooperacion entre los dos paises y dar beneficios reales a los pueblos de ambos paises promoviendo el intercambio y la cooperacion multifaceticos. 
					
					Ademas, intercambiaron los exitos y experiencias adquiridos en el curso de desarrollo socioeconomico y acordaron cooperar en el principio de respetar el regimen y la opcion por el desarrollo de la contraparte y hacer ingentes esfuerzos en el rumbo de preparar el ambiente juridico favorable a la circulacion monetaria e inversiones segun la ley y reglamentos nacionales y los principios y normas reconocidos en el ambito internacional. 
					
					Reconocieron unanimemente que consolidar y desarrollar mas las tradicionales relaciones de amistad y cooperacion con caracteristicas comunes en la geografia y la historia convienen a la aspiracion de los pueblos de los dos paises y harian aporte a la paz y estabilidad del Nordeste Asiatico y el resto del mundo. 
					
					La parte mongolesa explico de la iniciativa de "dialogo de Ulan Bator" sobre la seguridad del Nordeste Asiatico, presentada por el mandatario mongol, y la parte coreana presto atencion a ello y aclaro que respetaria la posicion de Mongolia como Estado desnuclearizado. 
					
					Ambas partes acordaron organizar periodicamente cada ano las negociaciones entre los cancilleres y estrechar la cooperacion en la Asamblea General de la ONU y otras reuniones internacionales. 
					
					La presente visita del mandatario mongol consolidara mas la amistad Corea-Mongolia de larga historia y tradiciones y promovera activamente el intercambio y cooperacion multifaceticos entre los dos paises.
